item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

You shouldn’t have an extra closing bracket there unless you’re closing the switch statement.

item.title: Staff Zone portal help
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

   case 8987: // Staff Zone portal
	 if (playerRights >= 1) {
            sM("You are a staff member, therefore you can enter.");
            sM("Welcome to the staff zone!");
            ToX = 2007;
            ToY = 4431;
            } else {
                 sM("You must be a member of staff to enter this portal.");
            }
            break;

You had your bracket outside the break.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff Zone portal help
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

I put this code in client.java under “Switch (ObjectID)”:

                case 8987: // Staff Zone.
 if(playerRights >= 1) {
        sM("You are a Staff Member, therefore you can enter");
        ToX = 2007;
        ToY = 4431;
        break;
    }

This is my Staff Zone. But when I compile, it comes with 100 errors. How can I fix it ?

Thanks.

Read full topic
